meanings.sent1: His constant teasing was antagonizing his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site was antagonizing the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was antagonizing the older dog by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved conflict between the two countries was antagonizing their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The persistent ringing of the alarm clock was antagonizing his peaceful sleep.

meanings.definition: Act in a way that causes someone to feel hostile or angry.
meanings.sent1: She knew that her rude comments were antagonizing her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive behavior of the customer was antagonizing the store employees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was antagonizing the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The constant barking of the dog was antagonizing the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet was antagonizing her nerves.

meanings.sent1: His sarcastic remarks were antagonizing his colleagues at work.
meanings.sent2: The persistent honking of the car behind him was antagonizing the driver.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was antagonizing the cat by pulling its tail.
meanings.sent4: The ongoing construction noise was antagonizing the residents of the apartment building.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of the mosquito was antagonizing her during the night.
